net.rcode.nanomaps.overlay
Class CircleOverlay

java.lang.Object
  View
      net.rcode.nanomaps.overlay.CircleOverlay
All Implemented Interfaces:
MapStateAware
Direct Known Subclasses:
UncertaintyHeadingOverlay
public class CircleOverlay
extends View
implements MapStateAware

Display a circle whose radius is represented in projected map units (typically meters). This is not strictly cartographically correct but for a conformal projection, it will be fairly accurate over small areas. It is often visually better to take the (small) error rather than distort the shape into an ellipse.

Author:
stella

Field Detail

FUDGE_PADDING

protected static final int FUDGE_PADDING
Add fudged padding to the width and height. Should be an odd number. Makes sure to capture an anti-alias effects, etc.

setLayoutParams

public void setLayoutParams(LayoutParams params)

mapStateUpdated

public void mapStateUpdated(MapState mapState,
                            boolean full)
Description copied from interface: MapStateAware
Called when the mapstate has changed. If full is false, then it can be assumed that this update is purely related to the origin is changing. Otherwise, assume that the full geometry has changed.

Specified by:
mapStateUpdated in interface MapStateAware

calculateSize

protected int calculateSize()
Calculate the needed size of the display area. The box defined by size must have the anchor point at the center.

This method should also stash any other state it needs to draw. It will only ever be called if mapState!=null

Returns:
size of the drawable area
